intro: Centaurium sylvaticum, commonly known as the woodland centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Centaurium sylvaticum is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a herbaceous perennial.
